Chicago Easter Brunches For Every Taste From Grand Buffets To Easter Egg Hunts, Here's What To Expect Monica Kass Rogers for 4 Star Restaurant Group By Audarshia Townsend Updated March 24, 2016 . 
This year, Easter falls on Sunday, March 27, and lucky you will be spending the momentous occasion in Chicago. Brunches abound, of course, and we've got the top picks so you can make a reservation now. Also, if you're looking for something to do after brunch, we've compiled a fun list of cultural attractions and shopping destinations to check out that are in walking distance of each restaurant. 
III Forks Prime Steakhouse . The meat-centric eatery offers a prix-fixe, three-course menu for $50 per person ($17 for children 12 and under). It's available 11 a.m.-9 p.m., and diners get to choose from dishes like a double-cut, herb-crusted lamb chop and roasted tenderloin. An a la carte menu is also offered. 180 N. Field Blvd., 312-938-4303 
Acadia . Award-winning chef Ryan McCaskey puts his stamp on Easter brunch with unique dishes that will be offered a la carte. Selections include Peekytoe crab hash, Maine lobster Benedict, Southern-inspired fried chicken and Maine blueberry pain perdu. 
continue reading below our video Best Road Trip Apps Each table will be greeted with a complimentary plate of pastries. Acadia will also offer special brunch beverages, including mimosas and a Bloody Mary with oyster granita. Brunch is 11 a.m.-3 p.m. 1639 S. Wabash Ave., 312-360-9500 
Nearby attractions: Chicago Architectural Foundation River Tour , Chicago Carriage Rides, House of Blues, Shops at North Bridge 
Bistronomic . The seasonal, three-course, French-focused brunch menu is $40 for adults; $19 for children 10 and under. There's an additional $16.95 for those indulging in "bottomless" Mimosas. Highlights include short stack pancakes, Hangar steak with two eggs, and Brioche French toast. Brunch runs 9:30 a.m.-4 p.m. 840 N. Wabash Ave., 312-944-8400 
Nearby attractions: Chicago Museum of Contemporary Art , Historic Water Tower , Water Tower Place 
The Blanchard . The much-buzzed about newcomer to Lincoln Park is also featuring a French-inspired brunch for Easter. It's $48 per person for three courses, and diners will get choices like house-cured Loch Duart salmon, a Maine lobster club, quiche Lorraine and classic profiteroles. A number of brunch cocktails will also be offered, including The Blanchard's signature mimosa. 1935 N. Lincoln Park West, 872-829-3971 
Nearby attractions: Lincoln Park Zoo 
Nico Osteria . Located on the lobby level of Thompson Hotel Chicago , the Italian seafood-focused restaurant celebrates Easter with a $65 four-course, prix-fixe menu. That includes pastries, a choice of cocktail, antipasti, piatti and dessert. It may also be ordered a la carte. Brunch is 9 a.m.-3 p.m. 1015 N. Rush, 312-994-7100 
Nearby attractions: Broadway Playhouse , Chicago Carriage Rides , Hancock Observatory , Lookingglass Theater 
Porkchop . A great option for larger groups, Porkshop's prix-fixe menu is $19 per person. It's also served with fresh fruit or a Bloody Mary. Some of the choices for the two-course brunch include gumbo, eggs Benedict and beer-battered catfish filets. Three locations: 941 W. Randolph St.; 1516 E. Harper Court; and 100 Nugent Street in Glenwood, Ill. 
Pump Room . The iconic restaurant on the lobby level of Public Hotel serves its regular a la carte brunch menu with a few special additions for Easter: Eggs Benedict with the option of crab cake; chocolate chip-and-banana pancakes with chocolate creme; and caramelized apple pancakes with apple and pear compote as well as candied pecans. Brunch runs 9 a.m.-3 p.m. 1301 N. State Pkwy., 312-229-6740
